localised_text.tooltip_text: This will clear all advice history so advice already given will be repeated.

flag_scale.componentleveltooltip: Determines scale of unit markers. At lowest setting, markers will be smaller and will not scale with distance, otherwise they will be larger and scale based on distance from camera.

label_context_name.comment: Fill in context object and function to match objects dealing with so can display object. Also feel free to add any other children such as icons want to display for each entry, etc

label_tx.componentleveltooltip: Trails make it easier to see missiles and their current path.

newstate.name: NewState
newstate.tooltip: When enabled, skirmish mode will be turned on by default for hybrid units (those equally as skilled at melee as at missile combat).||In skirmish mode, units will keep a safe distance from the enemy. Skirmish tactics can be employed to slow an advancing enemy or distract specific units. Skirmish units are vulnerable to cavalry charges.

label_tx.componentleveltooltip: When enabled, time will automatically change to slow motion while targeting abilities. Not available in multiplayer or when realism mode is active.

newstate.name: NewState
newstate.tooltip: If this is checked you will be able to see any visible CPU player's moves during the end turn phase.||This can help to keep a track on some of the CPU's locations and movements, but the end turn phase will also take longer.

label_tx.componentleveltooltip: When enabled, unit groups will be locked by default when created in battle.||Locked groups preserve the relative positions and facing of their units, from the point at which the group was created.
When enabled, the Spacebar will toggle the interface settings, rather than only appearing when it is held down.
When enabled, multiple units will drag out into a formation with melee in the centre, missiles behind and cavalry on the flanks.
Help markers show you where ships can disembark and where mountable artillery can be deployed.

If enabled, allows access to the context viewer developer tool by pressing your grave accent key (`). A kind of console that is very useful for help with modding UI, getting extra information in game and changing game state. Disabled in multiplayer. [[col:red]]Warning: Stability not guaranteed, use at your own risk![[/col]]
When enabled, skirmish mode will be turned on by default for missile units (excluding hybrid units equally as skilled at melee as at missile combat)

newstate.name: NewState
newstate.tooltip: When enabled, skirmish mode will be turned on by default for missile units.||In skirmish mode, units will keep a safe distance from the enemy. Skirmish tactics can be employed to slow an advancing enemy or distract specific units. Skirmish units are vulnerable to cavalry charges.

label_tx.componentleveltooltip: When enabled, guard mode will be turned on by default for units||Units ordered into guard mode will hold their position and will not pursue disengaged targets.

newstate.name: NewState
newstate.tooltip: When enabled, guard mode will be turned on by default.||Units ordered into guard mode will hold their position and will not pursue disengaged targets.

label_tx.componentleveltooltip: When enabled, units in battle will be coloured based on alliance to player instead of by faction colour, making them easier to distinguish.
When enabled, units will run to their given targets by default instead of walking.

newstate.name: NewState
newstate.tooltip: When enabled, units will run after issuing a movement order by default.

label_tx.componentleveltooltip: When enabled, will highlight units in battle that don't currently have any orders.

list_box.comment: Fill in the context object and context function in order to populate the available list of options for the dropdown menu

component_text.text: Additional interface settings are available in battle when holding down the Spacebar.

template_dropdown_entry.comment: Fill in context object type with what type need to store for diplay purposes and for passing along. Also feel free to change ContextCommandLeftClick to an initialiser or whatever else you want to handle when selecting an entry. Also feel free to add any other children such as icons want to display for each entry, etc

text_input_autosave_limit.componentleveltooltip: The number of individual save files to keep when using incremental auto-saves.
